TopicTitle: New Kerbalist with a Sad Sad Internet Connection

Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I'm fairly new to KSP and up until now I was not even able to take off

That's why I decided to actually get down and study the mechanics well in order to build a flying vessel by reading very deeply the Official Wiki...but there's a catch: I'm able to hook on a good internet connection very rarely (and I usually have to rely on very tight data-sticks with not so much data available) and it would help me very much if I could have such contents offline. Does it exist an offline version of the wiki or is it possible to obtain it only with methods such as ScrapBook and the like?

Cheers!

It Wont Work Off Line But If You Can Access Steam There Is A Lot Of Guides On There. I Have A Broken Internet At The Moment And It Works Fine

Edited August 19, 2013 by Platofan2

It Wont Work Off Line But If You Can Access Steam There Is A Lot Of Guides On There. I Have A Broken Internet At The Moment And It Works Fine

why is every word capitalized?

why is every word capitalized?

Because He Has A Peculiar Way Of Typing Stuff.
I can try to help you out. Backups of the wiki are not public (and I sure hope there are proper backups this time..), but I can still try to come up with something.

Voneiden: if you could help me with the wiki dumps that would be amazing and I'd really appreciate that!

Otherwise I'd just rely on a webcrawler at depth 3 and some filtering hoping that it gets all the interesting bits and nothing too messy comes out...

Cheers!

It's not perfect, but contains I suppose most of the first level pages and thumbnails. 630 pages in total.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/17806420/13-08-18-kspwiki.zip [20 megabytes]
Thanks a lot Voneiden! You really made my day!
